q_en: Which cutting tasks are for products categorized as T-shirt?

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM products WHERE products_type_id = (SELECT id FROM products_types WHERE description = 'T-shirt');
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs for products categorized as 'T-shirt'

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM order_product WHERE product_id IN (1, 3, 11, 19, 27);
steps.description: Retrieve the order product IDs for the products identified in Step1

steps.sql: SELECT ct.id, ct.start_time, ct.end_time, wg.name AS working_group_name FROM cutting_tasks ct JOIN working_group wg ON ct.working_group_id = wg.id WHERE ct.order_product_id IN (1, 3, 4, 2, 5);
steps.description: Retrieve the cutting tasks for the order products identified in Step2

response:
Sure thing! Let's dive into the cutting tasks for products categorized as 'T-shirt'. Here's what I found for you:

| Task ID | Start Time          | End Time            | Working Group Name |
|---------|---------------------|---------------------|--------------------|
| 1       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-01-18 00:00:00 | Master Sewers      |
| 4       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-01-17 00:00:00 | Master Sewers      |
| 5       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-02-02 00:00:00 | Master Sewers      |
| 2       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-02-02 00:00:00 | Master Cutters     |
| 3       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-01-19 00:00:00 | Master Cutters     |

These tasks are all set and ready to go! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. üòä
